Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigation class is used to make the robot navigate around the playing field.

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo​(Point destination)
        Travels to specific destination depending on whether the orientation of the robot is correct and whether the path is obstacle free. Turns the robot toward the destination by minimal angle. Takes the green zone and the red zone into account when it wants to travel. It considers 5 different cases: Case 1: We're already at the destination. Case 2: We're facing the right way and we know there won't be obstacles. Case 3: We're facing the right way and there might be obstacles. Case 4: We have to turn and we know there won't be obstacles. Case 5: We have to turn and there might be obstacles.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination point

      • directTravelTo

        public static void directTravelTo​(Point destination)
        Takes a point and moves directly toward it without concerning about the obstacles.
        Parameters:
        destination -

      • travelToObstacle

        public static void travelToObstacle​(Point destination)
        Moves forward and when it detects an obstacle calls avoid method from AvoidObstalce Class. When it passes the obstacle or it is close to destination calls directTravelTo.
        Parameters:
        destination -

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo​(double angle)
        Turns the robot with a minimal angle towards the given input angle in degrees, no matter what its current orientation is. This method is different from turnBy().

      • getDestinationAngle

        public static double getDestinationAngle​(Point current,
                                         Point destination)
        Gets the angle to the destination point.
        Parameters:
        current - Current position of the robot
        destination - Destination point
        Returns:
        the destination angle

      • minimalAngle

        public static double minimalAngle​(double initialAngle,
                                  double destAngle)
        Calculates the minimal angle to turn in degree.
        Parameters:
        initialAngle - initial angle of the robot
        destAngle - destination angle
        Returns:
        toTurn the minimal angle

        p2 - Second point
        Returns:

      • pathInGreenZone

        public static boolean pathInGreenZone​(Point start,
                                      Point end)
        Checks if the path between two points is in the green zone(no obstacles).
        Parameters:
        start - Starting point
        end - Ending point
        Returns:
        true if it is in green zone

      • comparePoints

        public static boolean comparePoints​(Point cur,
                                    Point destination,
                                    double tolerance)
        Takes current point and destination points and compare them. If the difference is less than the tolerance returns true
        Parameters:
        cur - Current point
        destination - Destination point
        tolerance - Tolerated difference
        Returns:
        true if points are the close

        public static int convertDistance​(double distance)
        Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.

        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to cover the distance in degrees

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle​(double angle)
        Converts input angle to total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate robot by that angle.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the wheel rotations (in degrees) necessary to rotate the robot by the angle
